com.globalros.tftp.server
Class ClientHandler

java.lang.Object
  com.globalros.tftp.server.ClientHandler
public class ClientHandler
extends java.lang.Object

However this class is called ClientHandler it is meant to be the class that handles the actual client tftp transfers.

Author:
marco

Field Summary
static int DEFAULT_TSIZE
           
 
Constructor Summary
ClientHandler()
          Creates a new instance of TFTPSocket
 
Method Summary
 void connect(java.net.InetAddress inetAddress, int clientPort)
          Connects the clienthandler to the client, packages send do not need to contain a address.
 void disconnect()
          disconnects from the client, any packet send after a disconnect needs to contain a destination address and port, because nne is available on the socket.
 boolean getAckReceived()
           
 java.lang.String getClient()
          This method returns the IP address and port number of the client this class is talking to.
 int getTimeout()
          Returns the timeout to wait for package in seconds
 int getTransferSize()
          Returns the tsize.
 void newRequest()
           
 boolean receiveFileFromClient(java.io.OutputStream os, java.net.InetAddress clientAddress, int clientPort, boolean useOptions)
           
 boolean sendFileToClient(java.io.InputStream is, java.net.InetAddress clientAddress, int clientPort, boolean useOptions)
          This method will send a file to the client after a read request Because the client buffers are slow to process the package in case of the LSDM it will set a special flag when a package is resent, as soon as the data is acknowledge the next data packet will be sent, it will check and see the special flag, clear the flag and sent for once the new data packet with a doubled time out this gives the LSDM time to also process the possibly delayed data package
 void sendLastAckForDataPacket(DATA data)
          Use this method to see if the last ack was sucessfully sent and the data does not need to be resent.
 void setAckReceived(boolean ackReceived)

          Sets the timeout to wait for package in seconds

          Sets the tsize.
 boolean waitingForNewRequest()

Constructor Detail

ClientHandler

public ClientHandler()
              throws java.net.SocketException
Creates a new instance of TFTPSocket

Method Detail

connect

public void connect(java.net.InetAddress inetAddress,
                    int clientPort)
Connects the clienthandler to the client, packages send do not need to contain a address. If they do they are overwritten by the ones of the connected socket.

Returns:

disconnect

public void disconnect()
disconnects from the client, any packet send after a disconnect needs to contain a destination address and port, because nne is available on the socket.

getClient

public java.lang.String getClient()
This method returns the IP address and port number of the client this class is talking to.

receiveFileFromClient

public boolean receiveFileFromClient(java.io.OutputStream os,
                                     java.net.InetAddress clientAddress,
                                     int clientPort,
                                     boolean useOptions)

sendFileToClient

public boolean sendFileToClient(java.io.InputStream is,
                                java.net.InetAddress clientAddress,
                                int clientPort,
                                boolean useOptions)
This method will send a file to the client after a read request Because the client buffers are slow to process the package in case of the LSDM it will set a special flag when a package is resent, as soon as the data is acknowledge the next data packet will be sent, it will check and see the special flag, clear the flag and sent for once the new data packet with a doubled time out this gives the LSDM time to also process the possibly delayed data package

getTimeout

public int getTimeout()
Returns the timeout to wait for package in seconds

Returns:
timeout in seconds

setTimeout

public void setTimeout(int timeout)
Sets the timeout to wait for package in seconds

Parameters:
timeout - The timeout to set

getTransferSize

public int getTransferSize()
Returns the tsize.

Returns:
int

setTransferSize

public void setTransferSize(int tsize)
Sets the tsize.

Parameters:
tsize - The tsize to set

sendLastAckForDataPacket

public void sendLastAckForDataPacket(DATA data)
Use this method to see if the last ack was sucessfully sent and the data does not need to be resent. If it seems that a new request comes in from the same client we know that the ack was received successfully

setAckReceived

public void setAckReceived(boolean ackReceived)
